title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5903.3 - Preliminary proposals
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5903.3 - Preliminary proposals

State Regulations
(a) Before
filing a proposal as provided in section
5903.4
of this Part, a preliminary
proposal shall be filed with the executive director of the foundation on forms
supplied by the foundation or as authorized by the executive
director. (b) The applicant shall
adhere to schedules and guidelines established by the executive director for
the submission of proposals. (c) The
preliminary proposal shall provide the title of the project, the name of the
project director, a concise summary of the project, project duration, goal, budget and any other pertinent matters. (d) The preliminary proposal shall be
reviewed and evaluated by the foundation staff and appropriate consultants. Recommendations shall then be made to the executive director as to whether or
not a full proposal should be invited, as provided in section
5903.4
of this Part. (e) The executive director shall have the
full power and authority to approve or disapprove the preliminary proposal. He
shall notify the applicant of the approval or disapproval of the preliminary
proposal and, if it is approved, shall invite the applicant to submit a
proposal as provided in section
5903.4
of this

Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
5903.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
